title: One of my emails has disappeared from my inbox
content: I am using a Mac with Big Sur (macOS Monterey Version 12.7.3), and my email is POP, using Thunderbird Version 115.8. One of my emails has disappeared. It was in my inbox and now it is gone. The email is dated Feb 26, 2024 and is an email confirmation of an item to be shipped. Please help. Delano Attride

title: Thunderbird calendar
content: It has been about a week now since 115.8 tried to install on my Windows 10 but could not without my password. I have been on Auto update for years now and could not put in correct password. It was suggested I go back to 102 and start over with a new account. I did. I have 102 and can send and receive emails. Problem is 102 does not show all emails that show in my same account when I log into Ionos.com host of my email account. I created another problem going to Thunderbird 102, birthdays. I have no access to my Thunderbird calendar not only for this month but all months this year and forever. I made a copy of everything in my account prior to going back to 102 to get a new password. How to I get my 2014 calendar back. And first thing I do if and when I get it back is to use a pen and paper to write down birthdays and whatever I want to remember and save it on paper just in case this happens again? Thanks.
creator: email14

title: Thunderbird Toolbar Customization Problem
content: I would like to add Separators (lines) to the main window of Thunderbird (see pic). I installed the Message Header Toolbar Customize extension to add spacers and separators to any toolbar, but you can only add separators to the New Message (Write) window (see pic) and the Reply Window (see pic). As you can see, my main window does not have separators. When I click on Customize in the main window or the Mail Space, the separator button is not available for the Mail Space. Why am I not able to put separators on my main window/mail space toolbar?

title: Backing up profiles in 157.7.0 and restore o another computer
content:
Made a mistake and installed 157.7.0 on Linux

Now cannot backup/restore to another computer so cannot use that computer.

Old Profile used to be in .thunderbird folder - easy!

Now profile seems to be in /home/oem/snap/thunderbird/common/.thunderbird/26pphmrb.default

This does not contain all emails especially for pop3 and anything after Nov 23. It does not work

Q's

Best way to fix? Can I force it TBird to read the .thunderbird in home directory? Can I install an older version of TBird easily? Is there some other way to restore the profile and clone another computer?
creator: marksmail2

title: Word wrap suddenly stopped working
content:
Until this afternoon, the emails I wrote all had a word wrap at 72 characters. Now I get a long line of text without the wrapping. I can not locate any place in the settings (an area which I usually avoid because I don't know what half of those switches will do).

I'm old (80) and old school to boot, so please be clear in providing me with the steps I need to take to restore that 72-character wrap. Thanks for any (and all) suggestions.

Jim

P.S. Yes, I am a BitWrangler as I started with assembly on an IBM360 in 1982.
creator: jkenning

title: switching between Mac and Linux Client leads to email goes to junk folder
content:
I switches between my Linux and Mac Notebook once a day. Everytime i switch a specific email gets moved to the junk folder. Then i mark it as not junk. As long as i stay in this client everything is fine. When i switch the notebook the client on this system marks this email as junk again. When i mark it as non junk and switch to the other system this email gets marked as junk again.

How can i mark it on both as non junk so this behaviour described above does not happen again?

Best Regards Trashcoder

title: Cambio password troppo frequente per l'accesso alla PEC di ARUBA.
content: Salve, ho un problema di accesso alla mia PEC offerta da ARUBA. Mi viene chiesto da Thunderbird di rinnovare la password con troppa frequenza, quando tento di inviare una PEC, ad intervalli anche di qualche giorno. Ho chiamato l'assistenza di ARUBA che mi ha rassicurato che non ci sono accessi anomali sul loro server a mio nome e che non sono il primo utente ad avere questo tipo di problema con Thunderbird, pertanto mi hanno invitato a contattare la vostra assistenza, perchÃ© gli utenti che utilizzano altri editor di posta elettronica non lamentano questo inconveniente. Resto in attesa di vostre delucidazioni. Cordiali saluti.

title: Link non cliccabili
content: Salve, scusate il disturbo. Vi contatto per esporvi il seguente problema: Ricevendo un l'email tramite un sito internet (confermato che i tag sono corretti), ricevo i link in maniera del tutto non cliccabile ma solo testo. Se la stessa email la inoltro, invio o altro, e vado successivamente a controllare su "inviate" qui i link sono diventati cliccabili. Ho provato a mandare tramite la mia personale gmail allo stesso account collegato su thunderbird e il link (banalmente ho provato con https://www.google.it/) viene visualizzato correttamente cliccabile. Ho provato di tutto e di piÃ¹: - entrare in modalitÃ  risoluzione dei problemi senza plugin e servizi attivi; - ho provato a ripristinare i dati di raccolta dello spam; - ho provato a mettere come eccezione l'email per i contenuti remoti; Ma nulla, quando ricevo l email, i link rimangono sempre e solo delle scritte non cliccabili. Potete aiutarmi? Saluti P.s. Thunderbird Ã¨ aggiornato all'ultima versione 115.8.0 (32 bit)
creator: christian.matarazzo.sr

title: Last major update
content:
I was completely satisfied with Thunderbird until the big update in autumn 2023. I've used it for over 15 years, with many mailboxes, with virtually no bugs.

Since then I have encountered the following errors. The last one is the most painful:

- Gmail accounts sometimes need to be re-authenticated - When I switch to a folder, I often can't see the mail there and have to switch to it again - The "Get Messages" icon is too small, inconvenient to use - The display of the number of unread messages is not as transparent as the old bracketed solution - Something has changed with the new message indicator (blue color) algorythm, because I sometimes miss a new message since then, what never occured before the update - If I don't use it for a while TB freezes several times a day and have to restart it
creator: 0dyss3us.laertiades

title: File link: Long Loading Copying That Never Ends
content:
Iâm a new Thunderbird user. Iâm using a Dell PC with Windows 10. Just tried sending a 7mb mp3 file to a recipient via FileLink. I set up a FileLink connection to a Send instance in the USA. Every attempt to send the file to a recipient resulted in endless loading and copying the message to my drafts folder and my sent folder, but the Send button on the message never darkened and allowed me to send the message. Also I get an error message from Thunderbird telling me it canât copy the message to my drafts and sent folders. After two plus hours of waiting, I had to cancel the messages. Tried restarting Thunderbird.

I tried using Dropbox instead but Dropbox always pauses my uploads no matter what I do and which browser I use. I ended up sending the mp3 file as a regular attachment. That eventually worked but again the message couldnât be saved to my sent folder, and again Thunderbird insisted on saving a draft copy while the very long file attachment loading process went on for over a half hour. My question is: why does it take so long for Thunderbird to load an attachment to a message, and why doesnât FileLink work? I tried to send a 1.6mb photo in jpg format to myself, and even that took a half hour, and I wasnât sure the process worked until I received my message with the photo. Do I need to disable my Norton software to use Thunderbird? Disable my browser extensions? Or do I just need to find a different email client?
creator: mightysparrow

title: Two Gmail accounts in Thunderbird, occasionally emails stop coming through
content:
For some time I have been using Thunderbird with three email accounts one of which is a Gmail account. This has generally worked OK. Every weeks or so a message came up asking me to allow Thunderbird to access my Google account to which I always said âAllowâ. I call this message the âGoogle panelâ. I am guessing this comes up whenever Thunderbird updates or whenever Google make some change. It is a bit irritating but I can live with it. Recently I have added in a second Gmail account, and since I have done this I have had a lot more problems. When the Google panel described above comes up I have to choose which of the two Gmail addresses it is asking me to allow access. There doesnât seem to be any way of knowing which one has made the request so I choose one of the two listed at random, if I guess correctly then everything continues normally but if I guess incorrectly I get an error (404). The good news is that if I guess incorrectly the panel reappears within a few seconds and selecting the other account sorts everything out. The more serious problem is that from time to time emails from one of the two accounts just stop coming through. A dialog box with the message âThe STAT command did not succeed. Error getting message number and sizes. Mail server pop.gmail.com responded: [AUTH] Invalid credentialsâ appears. This has happened to both of the accounts at different times for no obvious reason. After this happens it stays that way until the Google panel appears for the email address that has stopped working. This can take a couple of weeks. The only sure way that I've found to resolve this before the panel comes up is to clear the passwords for that account out of the password manager (Settings > Privacy and Security > Passwords > Saved Passwords). Then when I request Get Messages I am asked to allow Google to access the account, and once that has been done the account works again. This is obviously inconvenient and a fix that requires frequent implementation is not desirable. Even if I clear out all the passwords for both Gmail accounts and start fresh it is normally within a week that one of the accounts stops working as described above.

Some other facts about my setup: 

   Cookies are enabled (Settings > Privacy & Security, Accept third-party cookies)    I have it set up to store incoming emails from all accounts in a folder in Local Folders so I have a single inbox containing all incoming messages from all my accounts.    I use POP not IMAP    I leave the PC running overnight so Thunderbird is open continuously    I have two other non-Gmail accounts as well as the two Gmail ones    I have a Windows 11 PC and am currently using Thunderbird version 115.

Does anyone have any suggestions as to how I can prevent these problems and have both accounts running reliably? 

Barry Williams
creator: barryw99999
